title: Khabib 'to defend UFC title' against Tony Ferguson who moves above Conor McGregor in pecking order
text:
Khabib Nurmagomedov is reportedly agreeing a deal to next fight American Tony Ferguson in a New York mega-fight.

According to ESPN, Khabib is due to defend his UFC lightweight title at the Barclays Center or Madison Square Garden early next year, in either March of April.

Khabib last fought in September where he beat Dutin Poirier at UFC 242 with a third-round submission, but his unblemished record could be put to the test should he come up against the in-form Ferguson.

Khabib Nurmagomedov last fought in September in a submission win against Dustin Poirier

Tony Ferguson beat Donald Cerrone via a technical knockout in his last fight at UFC 238

That fight was Khabib's first bout since October 2018, and his famous clash against Conor McGregor which ended with a brawl between both camps.

ESPN's Ariel Helwani said of Khabib's next options: 'What is going on with Tony Ferguson? I suspect that Tony Ferguson vs. Khabib is going to happen March or April.

'I'm hearing that New York City is being discussed. Do I know Khabib? Yes, I have met him multiple times.'

Khabib, 31, previously stated that Ferguson was deserving of a shot at the title, given he is on a 12-fight win-streak dating back to 2012.

'I have to say that Tony Ferguson deserves it more, you have to give him credit,' asserted Nurmagomedov.

'He is on a 12-fight win streak and he deserves it more than Conor.

It looks like Conor McGregor will have to wait for a rematch with Khabib Nurmagomedov

'I'd fight all the main contenders first - Conor has to come back, stop hitting old people.

'He is a professional fighter, he should come back, win and earn his place and get in line.'

35-year-old Ferguson, who has a 25-3 record, last beat Donald Cerrone in June at UFC 238, after the doctor stopped the fight with Cerrone's right eye completely closing, meaning he could no longer continue.
